column4: halo, what document management system can i use that works under ubuntu, for architects sharing a lot of drawing files?
you could try alfresco.. it's quite a nice cms. bit bulky though and needs a fairly fast server
no ubuntu package for it though
cool i have seen alfresco, havnt been able to get it working though, install, weird :) will keep trying,
yeah, installed it for my employer
and were you happy with it?
works nice on a quad cpu xeon server with mysql
so far.. not rolled it out yet. still in testing
we will be replaceing sharepoint with it
the default hsql database is very slow compared to mysql on alfresco
but mysql is easy to implement
are you using tomcat, the boxed version that comes with alfresco?
had a few problems with version 2 of alf.. we are working with 1.4 at the momment but might give 2.0 annother shot soon
ok i will hit 2.0 will come back here and update you,
